page.title: 02BURFIELD HALL FARM
page.content: Mr Peter Phillip's father moved into Burfield Hall farm about 1925. Now the farm is run by Peter Phillips and his three brothers with their mother doing the accounts. It is a mixed arable farm of 214 acres and the crops grown are winter barley, wheat, sugar beet and beans for cattle feed. Stock kept are cows and calves. The farm is about 300 years old and the farm buildings 200-300 years old. A haulage business is also run from the farm. Of crops grown on the farm, malting barley for beer is taken to Tivetshall, wheat to Yarmouth for export to Poland and sugar beet to Bury St Edmunds. Cattle and Horses are also transported.
